bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., April 7, 1952

div1.p: Hench assures Rath that he should visit Rojas and Cabrera despite the unpromising political climate, because he believes the women need advice now.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., April 7, 1952
div1.opener:
April 7, 1952
Mr. Frederick L. Rath, Jr., Director
National Council for Historic Sites and Buildings
712 Jackson Place N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Rath:
div1.p:
By all means go to Havana. I have not changed
my mind. I think my friends are more confused
than ever and even though this may not be the
time to start legislative action, this is the
time when my friends need advice. I shall of
course be anxious to hear of your trip.

Is there a possibility that you can stay a day
or two extra if they want you to and if you
find it advisable?
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
